prompt: <description>Instructions for part_1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is twice the width. The length of the top and bottom faces is equal to the width. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.4109, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 1. Draw line_1 from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.0441, 0.0). 2. Draw line_2 from point (0.0441, 0.0) to point (0.0441, 0.0009). 3. Draw arc_1 from point (0.0441, 0.0009) with mid-point at (0.0433, 0.0029) to point (0.0413, 0.0037). 4. Draw line_3 from point (0.0413, 0.0037) to point (0.0092, 0.0037). 5. Draw arc_2 from point (0.0092, 0.0037) with mid-point at (0.0053, 0.0053) to point (0.0037, 0.0092). 6. Draw line_4 from point (0.0037, 0.0092) to point (0.0037, 0.0413). 7. Draw arc_3 from point (0.0037, 0.0413) with mid-point at (0.0029, 0.0433) to point (0.0009, 0.0441). 8. Draw line_5 from point (0.0009, 0.0441) to point (0.0, 0.0441). 9. Draw line_6 from point (0.0, 0.0441) to point (0.0, 0.0). 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0441. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by a value of 0.2205 towards the normal and 0.2205 towards the opposite direction of normals respectively. Parameters: - Length: 0.4409 - Width: 0.0441 - Height: 0.0441</description>
